timeline.bodyText: What happened to this poor thing?

timeline.bodyText: Out of curiosity, where's this data come from?

replies.author: neoancient

timeline.author: NickAragua

replies.bodyText: As mentioned in the PR description, the way I handled alternate munitions that can only be used by one weapon is to chain link them. So weapons that have alternate inferno ammo get two bins.
replies.author: neoancient

replies.bodyText: This code is agnostic. It works regardless of the number of bins linked to the weapon.
replies.author: neoancient

timeline.bodyText: The interior of this if block looks almost identical to the one in the TROView - 1, any reason why the # shots isn't displayed in the TRO view, and 2, any chance to unify this logic?
timeline.author: NickAragua

replies.bodyText: The method in TROView never gets called for support vehicles. I think what happened is that I started reworking TROView then realized that some differences in logic would require overriding it, but never removed the extra code from the parent class. This is what comes of working in 10-15 minute sessions with several days between.
replies.author: neoancient
